wikipedia_page.main: Paul Benedict Cullen, Lord Pentland,  (born 11 March 1957) is a former Solicitor General for Scotland, a Senator of the College of Justice (a judge of the country's Supreme Courts) and former Chairman of the Scottish Law Commission.

link_mentions.page: List of current members of the British Privy Council

response: *Paul Cullen, Lord Pentland (born 1957), Scottish judge and politician
* Paul Cullen, Lord Pentland, former Solicitor General for Scotland, now a Senator of the College of Justice (Holy Cross Academy)
* Paul Cullen, Lord Pentland (born 1957), Scottish judge and former politician

On 5 November 2008, the Scottish Executive announced he had been appointed to the Outer House of the Court of Session as Lord Bannatyne, filling the vacancy which had arisen from the death of Lord Johnston in June that year. His appointment came at the same time as those of Paul Cullen, Lord Pentland and Valerie Stacey, Lady Stacey. The men's decisions to adopt titles other than their own surnames drew comment in the press as straying from tradition.
